plugins.name: snapInsert
plugins.description:
snapInsert is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline the process of searching filtering and adding component instances into your designs.

Perfect for designers and teams who work with large design systems, Component Filter helps you save time and maintain focus on your design tasks.


Key Features:

‚Ä¢ Component Set Filtering: Easily filter components by their set names to focus on specific groups within your design system.

‚Ä¢ Dynamic Key-Value Filtering: Use key-value pairs to narrow down your search and find exactly what you need based on component properties like size, orientation, or any custom attributes.

‚Ä¢ Real-Time Results: As you apply filters, see immediate updates to the component list, ensuring you always have the most relevant components in view.

‚Ä¢ Intuitive UI: The plugin features a clean, user-friendly interface that integrates seamlessly with Figma, making it easy to apply filters and manage your components.


Note:

Currently, Component Filter only searches for components within the file you are working on. In future releases, users will be able to search components from published design libraries, expanding the plugin's functionality to cover broader design systems.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly search and insert component instances from sets or singles into your designs.

plugins.name: Component State Mapper
plugins.description:
Tired of getting lost in complex component variants? Struggling to track every possible state, prevent design inconsistencies, and explain component logic to your team?


Introducing State Mapper, the essential Figma plugin that transforms your complex component sets into clear, interactive, and easy-to-understand visual maps. Stop navigating your variants blindfolded and gain a bird's-eye view of your entire component architecture.


With a single click, State Mapper instantly generates a live flowchart of all your variants, showing you exactly how they connect and what properties change between them.


Key Features:


  2. üó∫Ô∏è Instant Visual Mapping: Automatically generate beautiful, easy-to-read diagrams from any component set. See the full picture, from simple buttons to complex data tables.
  3. üî¨ Powerful Filtering & Layouts: Is your map too complex? No problem. Isolate exactly what you need by filtering properties and values. Switch between Hierarchical, Graph, and Matrix layouts to find the perfect view.
  4. ‚ö†Ô∏è Smart "Missing State" Detection: Our most powerful feature! State Mapper intelligently analyzes your component's properties and automatically flags potential "holes" or missing variants in your system, helping you prevent bugs before they happen.
  5. ü§ù Seamless Handoff & Documentation: Export your component maps as SVG or PNG to include them directly in your documentation on Confluence, Notion, or Jira. Make sure developers understand the logic perfectly.
  6. üîÑ Live Sync: Keep your map updated in real-time. As you add, remove, or change variants, your map reflects those changes instantly.

Who is it for?


State Mapper is built for meticulous Product Designers, UI/UX Designers, and Design System teams who want to build more robust, error-free, and well-documented components.


Install State Mapper today and bring order, clarity, and intelligence to your design system!

accepted.name: 0mid madah
accepted.description: Product Designer by trade, problem-solver by nature. I build bridges between human needs and digital solutions, one pixel at a time.

plugins.tagline: Bring clarity to component chaos.

plugins.name: Variant Randomizer
plugins.description:
Tired of manually clicking through component variants one by one just to create visual variety in your mockups? Variant Randomizer is here to help! This simple yet powerful Figma plugin lets you instantly randomize the variants applied to multiple selected components or instances that have more than one variant option.


How it Works:

Select multiple elements (components/instances) on your canvas.

Run the [Plugin Name] plugin.

Done! The plugin automatically assigns a random variant to each selected element that has multiple variants available. Elements with only one variant or no variants will be ignored.


Why use Variant Randomizer?

Save Valuable Time: Stop the tedious process of manually changing variants across many elements.

Create Realistic Mockups: Quickly add natural variation to lists, grids, user avatars, button states, icons, and more.

Boost Productivity: Perfect for working with design systems and large sets of components.

Simple & Fast: One-click operation after selection.

Works on Selection: Target only the elements you need to change.



You can help me mantain this plugin by Buying me a coffee!
plugins.tagline: nstantly randomize component variants across your selection.

plugins.name: Version Linker
plugins.description:
Version Linker - Link and Manage Component Versions


A powerful version management plugin for Figma that helps you link and track different versions of your components across frames.


Key Features:

‚Ä¢ Create Main Version Links (MVL) to establish version control points

‚Ä¢ Add Secondary Version Links (SVL) to connect related components

‚Ä¢ Navigate instantly between linked components

‚Ä¢ Add descriptions to track changes and updates

‚Ä¢ Customize version colors for better visual organization

‚Ä¢ Manage versions with easy-to-use edit and delete functions


Perfect for:

‚Ä¢ Design systems with multiple component versions

‚Ä¢ Teams tracking component evolution

‚Ä¢ Projects requiring version history

‚Ä¢ Maintaining component relationships across frames


How it works:

1. Create an MVL with a version number and color

2. Add SVLs to connect related components in different frames

3. Add descriptions to document changes

4. Use the navigation buttons to quickly move between linked components


Stay organized and maintain clear version relationships in your Figma files with Version Linker.
plugins.tagline: managing version

plugins.name: Postcard Generator Experiment
plugins.description:
This plugin is a study project for the Generative AI course at the Innopolis University.


It tries it's best to generate greeting cards by combining layout generation, user-uploaded photos, a custom AI-generated poem and a thematic AI-generated background.


To run, get a token at an https://openrouter.ai and place it as the only text block on an empty page.


For help feel free to write me at levada.andrew@gmail.com


Github ‚Äî https://github.com/andrewlevada/postcard-generator-experiment

plugins.name: Storyteq CMP Asset Picker
plugins.description:
Introducing Storyteq CMP Asset Picker for Figma: Your shortcut to a faster design workflow.


Why You'll Love It:


Quickly find what you need: Easily search, filter, and sort through your CMP account assets, right from Figma.


All your assets, now available from Figma: See only the assets you're allowed to use, thanks to personalised access based on your CMP account.

plugins.name: Variable Linter
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that helps analyze, audit, and replace variables in your Figma designs. Scan selected layers for bound variables, categorize them by source, and efficiently replace variables with those from approved collections.


Features


üîç Variable Analysis


Deep Scanning: Analyzes nested components, variants, and instances

Source Categorization: Identifies variables as local, team library, or orphaned

Type-Safe Analysis: Categorizes variables by type (color, number, string, boolean)

Real-time Results: Instant scanning of selected layers


üìä Variable Management


Approval System: Mark specific variable collections as approved replacement sources

Bulk Operations: Replace multiple variables of the same type simultaneously

Individual Replacement: Replace variables one at a time with precise control

Orphan Detection: Identifies variables that no longer exist in their collections


üéØ Smart Filtering


Toggle Views: Switch between all variables and unapproved variables only

Sortable Tables: Sort by name, type, value, or source

Search & Filter: Find specific variables quickly


üìã Team Library Integration


Library Detection: Automatically identifies team libraries and shared collections

Permission Management: Configure which collections can be used as replacement sources

Compatibility Checking: Ensures replacement variables match original types

plugins.name: „Åº„Åã„ÅóËÉåÊôØ„Ç∏„Çß„Éç„É¨„Éº„Çø„Éº
plugins.description:
# Image Aspect Ratio & Background Blur Generator Plugin


## Overview


This Figma plugin automatically generates a new frame from selected images (or rectangles with image fills),

with a **specified aspect ratio and width, and a blurred background**.


- Useful for creating SNS thumbnails and other aspect-ratio-fixed images

- Supports batch processing of multiple images at once


---


## Main Features


- **Aspect Ratio & Width Customization**

Choose from custom ratios or presets (16:9, 4:3, 1:1, etc.). You can freely specify the width (px).


- **Background Blur Effect**

The original image is enlarged and blurred as the background, with the original image centered. Blur strength and scale are adjustable.


- **Batch Processing**

Select multiple images or rectangles with image fills and generate all at once.


- **Automatic Saving & Restoration of Settings**

Your last-used settings are saved in Figma's clientStorage and automatically restored on next launch.


- **Japanese UI**

Intuitive and easy-to-use Japanese interface.


---


## How to Use


1. **Select images or rectangles with image fills**

Multiple selection is supported.


2. **Launch the plugin**

Set the aspect ratio, width, blur strength, and scale in the UI.


3. **Click the "Create" button**

A new frame with the specified ratio, width, and blurred background will be generated to the right of the selected image(s).


4. **Notification**

Success and error messages are shown at the bottom of the UI with color distinction.


---


## Notes


- Non-image nodes are automatically skipped.

- Settings are saved per Figma file.


---


## Data Security


- This plugin does **not** send any user data, images, or personal information to external servers.

- All settings are stored locally using Figma's `clientStorage` API.

- No external API or server communication is performed.


---

133688.description:
# Image Aspect Ratio & Background Blur Generator Plugin


## Overview


This Figma plugin automatically generates a new frame from selected images (or rectangles with image fills),

with a **specified aspect ratio and width, and a blurred background**.


- Useful for creating SNS thumbnails and other aspect-ratio-fixed images

- Supports batch processing of multiple images at once


---


## Main Features


- **Aspect Ratio & Width Customization**

Choose from custom ratios or presets (16:9, 4:3, 1:1, etc.). You can freely specify the width (px).


- **Background Blur Effect**

The original image is enlarged and blurred as the background, with the original image centered. Blur strength and scale are adjustable.


- **Batch Processing**

Select multiple images or rectangles with image fills and generate all at once.


- **Automatic Saving & Restoration of Settings**

Your last-used settings are saved in Figma's clientStorage and automatically restored on next launch.


- **Japanese UI**

Intuitive and easy-to-use Japanese interface.


---


## How to Use


1. **Select images or rectangles with image fills**

Multiple selection is supported.


2. **Launch the plugin**

Set the aspect ratio, width, blur strength, and scale in the UI.


3. **Click the "Create" button**

A new frame with the specified ratio, width, and blurred background will be generated to the right of the selected image(s).


4. **Notification**

Success and error messages are shown at the bottom of the UI with color distinction.


---


## Notes


- Non-image nodes are automatically skipped.

- Settings are saved per Figma file.


---


## Data Security


- This plugin does **not** send any user data, images, or personal information to external servers.

- All settings are stored locally using Figma's `clientStorage` API.

- No external API or server communication is performed.


---

> - Instantly rename layers with AI (Qwen) based on design context

> - Group and organize layers by semantic prefixes

> - Preview and apply auto-layout frames with smart direction and spacing

> - Works with Figma‚Äôs latest auto-layout features

> - Great for design systems, handoff, and large files

>

> Save time, reduce manual work, and keep your Figma files organized and developer-friendly!

plugins.name: Pager
plugins.description:
Design-Ready File Templates in Seconds

Stop rebuilding your file structure every time.

Pager helps you spin up clean, structured Figma files with reusable templates built from your own component libraries or ours.


Whether you're starting a new product flow, setting up for research, or handing off to devs, Pager gives you a smart starting point so you can focus on design, not setup.


With Pager, you can:

Import full-page layouts from your published library components


  1. Use default templates for wireframes, UI, research, and more
  2. Create dynamic templates with text, boolean, and variant controls (Pro)
  3. Build faster with consistent, scalable structure


No setup? No problem.

Start from scratch or pick a default template.

Upgrade to Pager Pro anytime to sync your own library and automate your team‚Äôs workflow.

plugins.name: Quick Navigator
plugins.description:
Quick Navigator is a lightweight yet powerful plugin designed to help you stay oriented while working on large or complex Figma files. Instead of endlessly zooming and panning around, this plugin gives you a miniature view of your entire canvas thus making it easier than ever to find what you're looking for.


Features:

  1. See all your frames and sections in a simplified, scrollable mini window.
  2. Tap on any visible frame or section in the mini view to instantly select and focus it on the main canvas.
  3. Ideal when you're moving fast, experimenting, or managing chaotic canvases, no need for everything to be clean or structured.


NOTE: Currently, SVG shapes and text layers are not included in the mini view.
plugins.tagline: Never get lost on the canvas again!

plugins.name: Randomize
plugins.description:
How it Works:


Select Text Layers: Choose one or more text layers on your Figma canvas that you want to modify.


Open Randomize: Run the Randomize plugin.


Enter Your Items: In the input field, type or paste the different text strings you want to use, making sure each item is separated by a comma (,). For example: John Doe, Jane Smith, Alex Johnson, Maria Garcia


Click Randomize: Press the "Randomize" button.


See the Magic: The plugin will instantly replace the content of each selected text layer with a randomly selected item from the list you provided.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly populate selected text layers with random content from your custom list.
